creator: mshifflett@convera.com
text:
I've successfully used Tomcat on a number of UNIX platforms - Solaris, HP-UX, 
IRIX, Linux - but can't get it started on Digital UNIX (Alpha).  When I start 
it, I get:

% Usage: java org.apache.tomcat.startup.Tomcat {options}
  Options are:
    -config file (or -f file)  Use this file instead of server.xml
    -help (or help)            Show this usage report
    -home dir (or -h dir)      Use this directory as tomcat.home
    -stop                      Shut down currently running Tomcat

JAVA_HOME is set and TOMCAT_HOME is set.

Note that I WAS able to make things work by removing the "$@" from the lines in 
tomcat.sh that invoke the JVM.

creator: cmanolache@yahoo.com
text:
It is probably a problem with the shell - AFAIK $@ is a valid sh param.

Try using bash or a more "portable" shell. If you find a portable solution for
the sh. script that would work on all platforms, you can reopen the bug and add
a patch ( I have no access to a Digital Unix box to test ).

( the patch may be added for 3.3 - 3.2.2 is too late )
